page.title: 17THE VILLAGE OF KNOCK
page.content: Knock is a small secluded rural village of farms & cottages dating from 1750_1910.It has one long street with gardens behind the houses,farms at each end & 2 connecting backlanes. The main work of the village is connected with sheep farming.The 5 farms have allotments of land on the fells & the village is often inundated with hundreds of sheep being gathered for lambing,dipping,clipping or sales. There are 48 people living in the 25 houses,cottages & farms.3 cottages are holiday homes. There are 8 pensioners & 5 schoolage children.Those not involved in sheep-farming are employed in horticulture,the local gypsum mine,Shap cement works and there is 1 agricultural engineer,a Shetland pony breeder & a teacher.
